examples: Alex's genetics make him prone to premature aging, and he often looks like he's on the wrong side of sixty, even though he's in his fifties.
And yet such visions may be a bit premature.
So we use vitamin D in premature infants.
So you don't have a premature ignition.
Every year, air pollution is responsible for six million premature deaths worldwide from heart attacks, strokes and diabetes.
words.defineEn: (of a baby) born before the determined time of birth
words.defineVi: (của một em bé) được sinh ra trước thời điểm sinh được xác định

words.defineEn: characterized by deliberate purpose and some degree of planning
words.defineVi: được đặc trưng bởi mục đích có chủ ý và một số mức độ lập kế hoạch

examples: Number four, is preoccupied with being criticized or rejected in social situations.
You spend hours, preoccupied with it.
All of those things are going to really preoccupy their time.
I don’t remember being preoccupied with that.
And then there's the reverse where people are preoccupied with revenge.
words.defineEn: engage or engross the interest or attention of beforehand or occupy urgently or obsessively
words.defineVi: tham gia hoặc thu hút sự quan tâm hoặc chú ý trước hoặc chiếm giữ khẩn cấp hoặc ám ảnh

examples: Obviously the part of your notion is that what we understood, as the classroom method of teaching is not preordained, as the best way to teach.
It seemed like it was brought up as a kind of preordained policy.
words.defineEn: foreordain or determine beforehand
words.defineVi: định trước hoặc xác định trước

examples: Jem’s left arm is eventually deformed by Ewell.
Their combined strength deformed Mercury’s surface and created the mountains.
For example, Play-Doh plastically deforms almost immediately when force is applied.
There's our deformed ball.
It's not going to deform the brick in any way.
words.defineEn: become misshapen
words.defineVi: trở nên biến dạng

examples: Deformities cited as film defects by officials.
These types of tails usually form as a birth defect, a deformity of the spine called spina bifida.
The study found a clear correlation: the ponds with the highest Ribeiroia numbers had the most leg deformities.
In the 1950s, a group of ranchers in Idaho were baffled when their sheep gave birth to lambs with a singular deformity.
He's been outspoken about PFAS contamination, though the C8 Science Panel could not conclude his deformities were linked to PFAS.
words.defineEn: an appearance that has been spoiled or is misshapen
words.defineVi: một diện mạo đã bị hư hỏng hoặc bị biến dạng

examples: The journey home through the storm was absolute murder!
For all younger people in the US saving for retirement will be an absolute necessity.
For years he was an absolute penny-pincher.
Too many companies reckon without the pitfalls that make insurance like this an absolute necessity.
Peter noticed throughout history how rulers who were granted immense power often became tyrannical and cruel, proving that absolute power corrupts absolutely.
words.defineEn: complete and total, or free from any imperfection
words.defineVi: đầy đủ và toàn bộ, hoặc không có bất kỳ sự không hoàn hảo nào

examples: So, buying organic is still preferable, but does not grant you moral absolution.
words.defineEn: the act of absolving or remitting; formal redemption as pronounced by a priest in the sacrament of penance
words.defineVi: hành động miễn trừ hoặc chuyển nhượng; sự cứu chuộc chính thức được tuyên bố bởi một linh mục trong bí tích sám hối

examples: But I digress
So I digress with a little bit of psychiatric history.
But, anyway I digress.
But anyway, I'm digressing.
Male drone bees meanwhile basically only exist to mate with the queen and then die, I digress.
words.defineEn: to steer away from the matter at hand and focus on a different topic in speech or writing
words.defineVi: tránh xa vấn đề hiện tại và tập trung vào một chủ đề khác trong bài phát biểu hoặc bài viết

words.defineEn: a turning aside (of your course or attention or concern)
words.defineVi: quay sang một bên (của khóa học hoặc sự chú ý hoặc mối quan tâm của bạn)

examples: Their frontal lobes are virtually inactive.
Medial frontal cortex damage usually leads to mischievous dominant hands.
The frontal lobes are responsible for what's called executive functioning.
We didn't expect this full scale frontal attack.
These include smaller frontal lobes and hippocampal volumes.
words.defineEn: belonging to the front part
words.defineVi: thuộc phần trước

examples: This new frontier would be the most extreme challenge yet.
The men’s version of the union suit became popular on the frontier.
Will they close up the frontiers?
Jeff Bezos has already conquered the retail frontier.
As the sun rises over this corner of Ireland, first light bathes an invisible frontier.
words.defineEn: a wilderness at the edge of a settled area of a country
words.defineVi: một vùng hoang dã ở rìa của một khu vực định cư của một quốc gia

examples: Is there a scintilla of patriotism in his soul?
Adult judges in court have described in in court as a scintilla, a dab, even a glimmer.
words.defineEn: a sparkling glittering particle
words.defineVi: một hạt lấp lánh lấp lánh

words.defineEn: having brief brilliant points or flashes of light
words.defineVi: có những điểm sáng hoặc tia sáng ngắn

words.defineEn: deserving a curse
words.defineVi: đáng bị nguyền rủa

words.defineEn: the object of cursing or detestation; that which is execrated
words.defineVi: đối tượng của sự nguyền rủa hoặc ghê tởm; những gì được thực hiện

words.defineEn: causing intoxication
words.defineVi: gây say

examples: Falling in love was intoxicating.
It's like intoxicating power. -
That's a component of the cannabis plant that has significant therapeutic properties, but it's not intoxicating.
The intoxicating nutty aroma.
First white flowers, then bright-colored flowers, weird shaped flowers, intoxicating perfumes, all of them were like big neon signs.
words.defineEn: have an intoxicating effect on, of a drug
words.defineVi: có tác dụng gây say, của một loại thuốc

examples: I might consider myself a bibliophile and ailurophile, to profess my love of books and cats.
The president is a self professed billionaire who hasn't released his tax returns.
Much like Trump, Bolsonaro justifies his actions by professing to believe in miracle cures.
He becomes convinced that aliens (Tralfamadorians) abducted him and increasingly unmoored, Pilgrim publicly professes the Tralfamadorian vision of time and space.
In that the higher the level of education one attains, the more likely one is to profess liberal views on issues such as women's rights or abortion.
words.defineEn: admit (to a wrongdoing)
words.defineVi: thừa nhận (làm sai)

examples: The professor made mincemeat of the speaker at the conference.
The professor knew his subject from the ground up.
The professor will hold a seat on the advisory board.
The professor be damned.
The professor is a big cheese in the academic world, known for her groundbreaking research and expertise in the field.
words.defineEn: a faculty member at a college or university who has not yet attained job security or is at the rank below full professor
words.defineVi: một giảng viên tại một trường cao đẳng hoặc đại học chưa đạt được sự đảm bảo công việc hoặc ở cấp dưới giáo sư đầy đủ
